acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: These items came to the Library of Virginia in a shipment of court papers from Northampton County.

bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: Northampton was formed in 1634 (original shire). Previous name: Accomack County from 1634 to 1643.
The deed and will books of Northampton County in this collection were created by the County Court.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Deed Books, 1645-1718, of Northampton County Court. The deed book records the name of the grantor and grantee, the residence of both individuals and the description of property being sold or transferred. All of the volumes have indexes except (1651-1654 and 1654-1655) which contains the first and last names of both parties. It is arranged alphabetically from A-Z.

Will Books, 1645-1718, of Northampton County Court. The will book includes the name of testator, list of heirs and year the wills were proven in court and probate records such as inventories and appraisements. All of the volumes have indexes except (1651-1654 and 1654-1655) which contains the first and last names of both parties. It is arranged alphabetically from A-Z.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Additional Northampton Records can be found on microfilm at the Library of Virginia. Consult "A Guide to Virginia County and City Records On Microfilm" found on the Library of Virginia web site.
